Camping Directory
At over 80 Thousand Trails campgrounds, you can enjoy the best of outdoor recreation and family camping! Learn more with the Thousand Trails Directory of Campgrounds! Whether you have an RV or enjoy staying in a cabin, we encourage you to try a Thousand Trails campground near you!

Learn More » mod: 229 Annual Price: $755 Now Only $555 /year desktop only: Monthly Payment Option Available 1-877-730-5935 mod: 228 *Plus applicable taxes. Restrictions on use are explained in our @hrefFAQ. If you purchase a single region Thousand Trails Camping Pass (" Camping Pass ") by September 5, 2025, you will receive a $200 discount off the regular $755 annual dues. The $200 discount is only good for the first year. The single region Camping Pass includes use of the Thousand Trails campgrounds in one of five regions, for one year. You can add additional regions to your Camping Pass for $125 per region, for one year. In addition, you may choose to pay the annual fee in 12 monthly installments, provided that you commit to a two year agreement. For complete terms and conditions please click here. Applicable taxes and fees, if any, will be added to your annual dues. This offer cannot be combined with any other discounts or promotions. Usage is subject to length of stay restrictions. Must sign a Camping Pass Agreement. Offer is only available to new customers. Amenities vary by property. Existing members, employees of MHC Property Management, L.P., and its affiliates and residents of MN, MS, and SD are excluded from this promotion. If you purchase a Thousand Trails Camping Pass through our website or call center and are not satisfied with your Thousand Trails Camping Pass for any reason during the first 30 days after you sign the purchase agreement, or after you stay at a campground for not more than two consecutive nights, whichever comes first, you may cancel your purchase agreement and receive a refund. The Trails Collection is a reciprocal use program operated by Encore Royalty Club, L.L.C. (“Encore”) that allows participating Thousand Trails members to use campsites and other facilities at the RV resorts affiliated with the program. Encore is an independent company and does not own any of the resorts affiliated with the program. Encore provides access to these resorts through agreement(s) between Encore and the owners of the resorts. Guarantee Modal You’ll Love Our Campgrounds. We Guarantee It. If you purchase a Thousand Trails Camping Pass and are not completely satisfied during the first 30 days or after your stay (not valid if more than 2 days). You may cancel for a refund. How it works Modal Sherer Modal Modal for FAQ Thousand Trails Camping Pass: FAQs Q: What are my Thousand Trails Camping Pass payment options? A: The annual fee of $755 is payable in full at the time of purchase or in 12 consecutive monthly installments. (see following FAQ for restrictions). While there is no enrollment fee when buying a single Thousand Trails Camping Pass , if you do purchase more than one Region, you may finance the enrollment fee with as many as four installments. Details will be provided at check out. Q: How does the monthly payment option work for single Region purchases? A: As a convenience, you may pay the annual fee of $755 in 12 consecutive monthly installments ($62.92, plus any applicable taxes), provided that you commit to a 2 year agreement and agree to have the monthly installments automatically charged to your credit card or withdrawn from your bank account. The first payment is due at time of purchase. All payments must be made in U.S. dollars. The monthly payment option is not available in conjunction with our discounted offers. Q: How long is the term of the Thousand Trails Camping Pass? A: The initial term of a Thousand Trails Camping Pass is (a) one (1) year if you purchase one to five regions and you elect to pay the annual fee in full at the time of purchase or (b) two (2) years if you purchase one to five regions and you elect to pay the annual fee in monthly installments. At the end of the initial term, your Pass will automatically renew for additional one-year periods. You may cancel your membership by notifying us at least 30 days prior to expiration. Q: What are my use privileges? A: Your Thousand Trails Camping Pass entitles you to day use and overnight camping in your recreational vehicle or tent, subject to length of stay restrictions, at all campgrounds in the region(s) you select. During your stay you enjoy all the same amenities provided to those campers who book at the daily rate. Q: How long can I stay at a resort? A: While there is no limit to the total number of nights that you may use your Thousand Trails Camping Pass each year, we do set a maximum of 14 consecutive days for any particular stay at one of our resorts. Additionally, if your stay exceeds four consecutive nights, you must wait for seven nights before you stay again at any resort. Q: Who may use my Thousand Trails Camping Pass? A: Your Thousand Trails Camping Pass covers the purchaser, his/her spouse, and any dependent children age 23 and under who live at home or attend school away from home. Other family members may use the campgrounds as guests as set forth in the Usage Rules. Our spacious campsites can accommodate up to 10 persons, so don't forget to bring your friends along! Q: What if I purchase the Northwest Region but want to visit a different Region? A: You can upgrade your Thousand Trails Camping Pass to include additional regions at any time, by calling the Thousand Trails call center at 1-877-730-5935. NEW 5-REGION FAQs Q: I purchased a Northeast Thousand Trails Camping Pass previously and noticed that properties located in Illinois, Indiana, Michigan and Ohio are now in the Midwest Region, will I still have access under my current contract? A: Yes. Under the terms of your contract you will continue to have access to those properties identified in your initial contract as long as you renew and pay your annual dues each year. Q: I purchased a Southeast Thousand Trails Camping Pass that included Diamond Caverns in Kentucky. I noticed this location is now included in the Midwest Region do I still have access? A: Yes. Under the terms of your Southeast Region contract you will continue to have access to Diamond Caverns as long as you renew and pay your annual dues each year. NEW 5-REGION FAQs Q: What other discounts will I receive as a Thousand Trails Camping Pass member? A: All Thousand Trails members using their RVs receive discounts on stays at Encore Resorts. These discounts vary by resort. For a list of discounts please refer to the Thousand Trails website at www.ThousandTrails.com or our TrailBlazer magazine. Q: Do I receive a TrailBlazer magazine? A: Yes, your purchase of a Thousand Trails Camping Pass includes a annual subscription to our TrailBlazer magazine. Q: Does the Thousand Trails Camping Pass come with a moneyback guarantee? A: Yes. If you purchase a Region Park Pass through our website or call center and are not satisfied with your Region Park Pass for any reason during the first 30 days after you sign the purchase agreement, or after you stay at a campground for not more than two consecutive nights, whichever comes first, you may cancel your purchase agreement and receive a refund of your annual fee and (if applicable) enrollment fee. You must cancel your Region Park Pass by sending a written notice of cancellation to MHC Thousand Trails Limited Partnership, 6500 Pinecrest Drive, Suite 300, Plano, Texas 75024, Attention: Contract Processing. The notice must be postmarked by midnight of the 30th day after the day on which you signed your Region Park Pass purchase agreement or before you stay at a campground for more than two consecutive nights, whichever occurs first. Mailing by ordinary mail is adequate but certified mail return receipt requested is recommended. This guarantee does not apply to an upgrade after your initial purchase. Q: What if I have more Thousand Trails Camping Pass questions? A: Please feel free to call us at 1-877-730-5935 and we'll answer any questions you may have. Close Window No RV? No Problem! Perfect for those who enjoy glamping in style, in hundreds of unique vacation rentals with the new Thousand Trails Cabin Pass. LEARN MORE ABOUT THE Cabin Pass »

If you purchase a single region Thousand Trails Camping Pass (" Camping Pass ") by September 5, 2025, you will receive a $200 discount off the regular $755 annual dues. The $200 discount is only good for the first year. The single region Camping Pass includes use of the Thousand Trails campgrounds in one of five regions, for one year. You can add additional regions to your Camping Pass for $125 per region, for one year. In addition, you may choose to pay the annual fee in 12 monthly installments, provided that you commit to a two year agreement. For complete terms and conditions please click here. Applicable taxes and fees, if any, will be added to your annual dues. This offer cannot be combined with any other discounts or promotions. Usage is subject to length of stay restrictions. Must sign a Camping Pass Agreement. Offer is only available to new customers. Amenities vary by property. Existing members, employees of MHC Property Management, L.P., and its affiliates and residents of MN, MS, and SD are excluded from this promotion. If you purchase a Thousand Trails Camping Pass through our website or call center and are not satisfied with your Thousand Trails Camping Pass for any reason during the first 30 days after you sign the purchase agreement, or after you stay at a campground for not more than two consecutive nights, whichever comes first, you may cancel your purchase agreement and receive a refund. The Trails Collection is a reciprocal use program operated by Encore Royalty Club, L.L.C. (“Encore”) that allows participating Thousand Trails members to use campsites and other facilities at the RV resorts affiliated with the program. Encore is an independent company and does not own any of the resorts affiliated with the program. Encore provides access to these resorts through agreement(s) between Encore and the owners of the resorts.

About Us The Thousand Trails Difference For more than 50 years, Thousand Trails has been a leader in providing family-oriented campgrounds and RV resorts where outdoor recreation enthusiasts and RVers can enjoy nature in popular vacation destinations, complemented with amenities and activities for everyone to enjoy. ThousandTrails.com is the ideal site to browse and book more than 200 camping locations in some of the most desirable outdoor recreation and vacation destinations in North America. The site offers options to meet the preferences of every camper, from the weekend warrior to the full-time adventurer, and resorts and campgrounds with everything you need for a great getaway: awesome amenities, fun-filled activity calendars, and our commitment to quality service. Ways to Stay Come for a Visit Whether you want to enjoy the comfort of your own RV, rent a cozy cabin, or pitch a tent and sleep under the stars, the choice is yours! Stay with us for a weekend, a week or more. From mountains to beaches, action or relaxation, you’ll find a fantastic destination on ThousandTrails.com. While membership options abound, you can book a stay at any of the resorts and campgrounds on ThousandTrails.com without a membership. Stay for a Season Take the opportunity to truly unwind with us during a visit of a month or more! Join us for a full season in an area with beautiful weather, fun amenities, and welcoming fellow campers. A seasonal stay is the best way to explore a new area or spend time in a favorite place while making lasting friendships. Become a Member Thousand Trails has a variety of membership options available, including our Camping Pass and our Cabin Pass, which make camping easy, affordable, and fun. Choose the option that’s right for you, and camp all year for one low price! Something for Every Camper RV Sites Most of our campsites offer full hookups and feature picnic tables and fire rings with grills. We can accommodate a wide variety of RVs, from pop-up campers to Class A motorhomes. Vacation Rentals You’ll find a variety of vacation rental options on ThousandTrails.com. Cabins and cottages are commonly found at resorts and campgrounds across the site, but you’ll even find unique accommodations for rent such as yurts, glamping tents, and tiny houses. Pet-Friendly Pets love camping too, so don’t leave your furry friends behind! With over 200 pet-friendly locations across the country, you’ll find the perfect resort or campground wherever your travels take you and your pet. Most of our locations offer pet-friendly accommodations including cabins, cottages, and tiny houses, and many offer pet amenities like dog parks. Age Qualified Looking for a 55+ age qualified camping location? You’ll find several options on ThousandTrails.com. Check out our offerings in Arizona, where we have 20 age qualified locations, South Texas where we have a dozen to choose from, and Sunseekers in North Fort Myers, Florida. Meet Our Family of Campgrounds Enjoy year-round camping in the great outdoors at Thousand Trails’ network of campgrounds, with spacious campsites, hiking trails, fishing, and family fun. Destination Campgrounds Whether it’s just for a weekend or for the whole season, these top campgrounds have it all – from unique accommodations to family friendly activities to scenic locations. Escape to the beautiful sunny days and gentle warmth found at all our sunbelt resorts. With our resort-style amenities and variety of activities, you’ll want to stay all winter long. Fun for the Whole Family Each of our campgrounds is as unique as its location, offering fun for the whole family, with special theme nights like casino nights and Hawaiian luaus, social activities, recreational events, tournaments, concerts, cook-outs and more. You'll find a wide variety of amenities and activities at Thousand Trails campgrounds. Some of the most popular include: Clubhouses Horseback Riding Fitness Centers Bike Trails Golf Courses Shuffleboard Miniature Golf Dog Parks WiFi Pickleball Courts Picnic/BBQ Area Volleyball Banquet Halls Boat Rentals RC Race Tracks Softball Fishing Billiards/Game Rooms Swimming Pools Bocce Ball Tennis Courts Arcades Nature/Hiking Trails Laundry Facilities Property Improvements We strive to continually improve the camping experience at our resorts by regularly adding to and upgrading our amenities and facilities. View Improvements What Our Guests Say Four Kids. Pet Lovers. The Sherer family loves their Camping Pass. Watch Their Story The Sherer family loves their Camping Pass. Watch Their Story We joined the Thousand Trails family at the Idyllwild CA Preserve in 1984. We started out with our family of 4 in a 10-foot camper atop a ’79 Chevy Truck — often there were additional kids along which just added to the great times that we shared camping among the beautiful pine trees atop the mountain. We thoroughly enjoy our membership and have never regretted the decision that we made some 24 years ago. Suzanne & John B. My wife and I have been members for the last 6 years, and camped as guests before that. Our family has had many wonderful experiences with Thousand Trails as we have traveled over the years. No matter where we are, the staff has always made us feel welcome. We would strongly recommend that anyone who camps become a member. Mary & Art M. Where in America are you going to find 24-hour security in a prime location and a warm atmosphere – at Thousand Trails preserves. Lori K.
